## Bioinformatics, <a href="https://estudis.uoc.edu/ca/masters-universitaris/bioinformatica-bioestadistica/" target="_blank"><em>Universitat Oberta de Catalunya</em></a>


<p style='font-size:15px;color:gray'><em style='color:black;'>*March 2021 - Present*</em><br>
Master's thesis student</p>

---

In the context of my master's thesis (*MSc in Bioinformatics & Biostatsistics*), and under the suprevision of [Dr. Izaskun Mallona](https://imallona.bitbucket.io/), I decided to unravel the *ignorome* of colon cancer. The ignorome, defined by [Pandey *et al*](https://journals.plos.org/plosone/article?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0088889), consists in the genes that can be important in the biological context of a tissue or disease, but that haven't been well studied or related to that context because of publication biases or due to other reasons.
